title: Ways to Protect Assets from a Civil Judgment
question: I'm probably going to have a large civil judgment levied against me in California state court, although right now I have none.
answers:
If you do not have a good lawyer defending you, take out a mortgage and use the money to hire one.

Know that anything you do now can be scrutinized by a bankruptcy court (if you end up filing bankruptcy to avoid the judgment) or the Plaintiff's attorney (if you do not and you lose the lawsuit). Tread very carefully.

Tread carefully or you could make things worse.

I don't see a fraudulent conveyance here, because it sounds as if you are getting value for the house. You are not transfering it to someone for less than it is worth.

Nonetheless, a creditor could come after your interest in the house, or your interest in the LLC. In addition, your friend is suggesting entangling himself in your problems.

If you have a large judgment pending, you should be seeking counsel of an attorney rather than asking for free advice on the internet.

IIt is impossible to provide an accurate answer without all the elements (Details and circumstances of the potential civil lawsuit, the amount of the potential claim, the exposed net worth (your liquid assets and your primary residence-duplex, etc…).

Bankruptcy or using specific legal tools may be an option. However, any attempt you make now to put an asset out of reach of a potential creditor may be regarded by a judge as fraudulent conveyance. You need to schedule a consultation with a bankruptcy or an asset protection attorney as soon as possible.

You might want to consider a bankruptcy to avoid some or all of the debt. A bankruptcy attorney would be able to determine if you could do a chapter 7 to wipe it all out, or if you will need a chapter 13 to protect equity that you cannot exempt. Talk with one NOW so you do not do anything that will cause you to lose your home.

Those actions would almost certainly be construed as fraudulent conveyance by the Court. Essentially, any action you take with regard to assets, once you are aware that there is a possibility of a judgment, can be unwound by the Court. You need to speak with an attorney asap.
